Title: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Officer
Description:
About Us

At Founders Pledge, our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to do immense good. Since launching in 2015, we’ve raised over $12 billion for the most impactful social causes. We offer the simplest path to impact for successful entrepreneurs, providing end-to-end giving infrastructure, pioneering research, and access to a worldwide network of experts.

In other words, we help tech leaders become strategic philanthropists. Our 2,200+ members include the people behind industry-leading companies such as Airbnb, UiPath, Dropbox, Skype, Spotify, and Uber.

About The Role

Founders Pledge has significantly scaled the volume, size, and dynamism of its grants. While we are strong on pre-grant research, forecasting, and prioritisation, this growth has highlighted the need to further strengthen our post-grant monitoring and learning as we scale.

We’re looking for a Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) Officer to join our Impact Analytics team, reporting to the Head of Insights and Analytics, to systematise how we learn from our grants — understanding what happens after funding and translating those insights into better future decisions.

The Purpose Of The Role Is To


Assess real-world outcomes against pre-grant impact forecasts
Build feedback loops that improve calibration and decision quality over time
Generate credible, decision-useful impact evidence and narratives
Support Founders Pledge’s shift from purely theoretical impact toward something more tangible, testable, and learnable


You’ll work closely with colleagues across Impact Analytics, Research, and other teams to ensure insights from post-grant learning meaningfully inform future grantmaking.

Want a short overview from the hiring team?

We’ve recorded a brief Loom video explaining why this role exists, how it fits within Founders Pledge, and what makes it different from a traditional MEL position.

▶️ Watch the 3-minute video here

What You'll Do


Run post-grant monitoring for Founders Pledge’s most strategically important grants
Compare actual outcomes against forecasted impact and underlying assumptions
Own low-lift MEL approaches (e.g. structured check-ins) and contribute to higher-lift evaluations and stress-testing where appropriate
Build and maintain a growing evidence base on the accuracy and calibration of impact forecasts
Surface insights and patterns across grants to support internal learning and decision-making
Collaborate with the Communications team to support credible impact storytelling and external collateral
Support site visits and direct engagement with grantees where valuable


What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a thoughtful, analytically strong, and learning-oriented evaluator who is excited by complexity, uncertainty, and real-world impact.

You’ll be motivated by understanding what worked, what didn’t, and why — and by feeding those insights back into better future decisions.

Must-haves


Strong quantitative and analytical reasoning skills
Comfort working with uncertainty, imperfect data, and incomplete information
Experience with monitoring, evaluation, and learning in complex systems
Ability to interpret data holistically, combining quantitative and qualitative signals rather than relying on single metrics.
Ability to synthesise insights and communicate them clearly to diverse stakeholders


Nice-to-haves


Exposure to cost-effectiveness or impact modelling
Experience in global development, public policy, or philanthropy
Strong ability to translate analysis into clear, credible narratives
Active listening and facilitation skills to understand the needs and utility of MEL for diverse stakeholders


Indicators of Success

Over Time, Success In This Role Would Look Like


Clear, repeatable post-grant MEL processes embedded across major funding decisions
Evidence that impact forecasts are being systematically calibrated and improved
Credible, actionable insights feeding back into research and funding decisions
Clearer post-grant results and lessons, available for internal and external use


Location, Travel, and Salary


This role can be fully remote
Location: UK, US East Coast, or Germany
Salary: Up to £48k / $85k / €60k, depending on location and experience
If not London-based, occasional travel to London (or vice versa) will be required for collaboration
There may be opportunities to personally conduct site visits in low- and middle-income countries, but travel is not a requirement of the role
All staff are expected to attend periodic team offsites and an annual global offsite


Why Work With Us?

You can find more about the benefits we offer here, but what makes us truly special is both our mission and our people.

We’re a diverse team, from both charitable and commercial backgrounds, who believe that amazing things can happen when we tackle problems together.

We offer a flat structure and an opportunity to help shape the future of philanthropy.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Founders Pledge. We seek people with different strengths, experiences, and backgrounds, who share our drive to understand and solve complex social challenges.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Finding solutions to the world’s most pressing problems requires different perspectives and unique ways of thinking, and we are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can do their best work.

If you’re excited about our mission but don’t meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

Title: Data Scientist (Student / Working Student) – Cloover ⚡
Description:
Intro



At Cloover, we’re building Europe’s most exciting climate-tech platform—making renewable energy financing as seamless as buying a coffee. As a Data Scientist, you’ll be at the heart of this mission: turning messy real-world data into insights that help families power their homes with solar energy, batteries, and heat pumps.

You’ll work closely with our finance, sales, and marketing teams, supporting decisions that directly move the needle on Europe’s energy transition.





Your mission










What you’ll do:

Design, test, and refine credit risk and portfolio models that decide how we finance renewable energy projects.

Dive into massive datasets in Google BigQuery, finding patterns that improve everything from conversion rates to portfolio performance.

Build beautiful dashboards in Metabase that make key business metrics come alive for our leadership and investors.

⚙️ Develop and automate data pipelines and predictive models, shaping how we use data across the company.

Explore customer and market data to discover insights that fuel growth—and make our financing smarter and greener.

Turn complex findings into clear, visual stories for teams, lenders, and investors.

Why it’s awesome:

You’ll get hands-on experience in climate finance, fintech, and data science—all at once.

You’ll collaborate directly with founders and senior team members.

You’ll see your work have real-world impact on renewable energy adoption.





Your profile



You’re a student or recent graduate from a top-tier university, studying data science, statistics, computer science, finance, or a related field—and you’re eager to turn theory into real-world impact.

You’re fluent in at least one of Python, SQL, or R (bonus points if you can juggle all three) and love getting hands-on with data.

You have a solid grasp of statistics, probability, and machine learning, and you’re curious about how numbers shape smart financial decisions.

You’ve already flexed your analytical muscles through internships, side projects, or academic work in areas like data analysis, financial modeling, or credit risk.

You’re intrigued by financial markets, debt instruments, or renewable energy—and want to learn how they intersect.

You’re a problem-solver who thrives on detail, ownership, and seeing projects through from idea to insight.

You’re fluent in English (German is a plus, but not a dealbreaker).

⚡ You’re passionate about climate action and want to work where your skills can help decarbonize the planet.

You’re available for a 3–6 month internship, starting as soon as possible.





Why us?



Urban Sports Club membership – stay active and recharge, on us.

Fast growth track – show results, and your career will move just as fast.

Central Berlin office – a vibrant workspace in the heart of Europe’s startup capital.

Global exposure – collaborate with an international team and Triple-A investors shaping the future of climate finance.





About us



At Cloover, our mission is to empower 1 billion people to become part of the sustainable world of tomorrow by providing hassle-free access to renewable energy at the click of a button. Join the race to achieve Net Zero and enable everyone to play a role in the energy transition.

We’re building the OS for renewable energy installers, streamlining their operations from financing to working capital management. Our platform enables providers of renewable technologies to offer embedded financing options to their customers, empowering more individuals and businesses to install solar panels, battery storage, EV charging stations, and heat pumps, transforming them into independent energy suppliers.

We aim to make sustainable financing simpler, faster, and more affordable, bringing renewable energy to every household and business.

We are on an exciting growth journey, currently operating in the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, and Germany, with plans to expand to additional European markets in the coming year.

Title: Applied LLM / Data Scientist
Description:
Synagen builds specialized AI agents for healthcare and oncology, designed to support complex clinical decisions and biomedical workflows with actionable, high-precision outputs. We combine modern AI with clinical expertise to create software that integrates into real provider environments and delivers value in practice.


Aufgaben


Synagen builds AI agents for healthcare and oncology that integrate into real clinical workflows. As our Applied LLM / Data Scientist, you will help turn high-volume patient and clinical data into scientific, research, and clinical insights—by building the data and model operations layer that makes this reliable, scalable, and compliant. A core part of this role is applied research and analytics delivery with pharma partners: you will work customer-near on real projects, translate scientific questions into data products and agent workflows, and ship outcomes that can be used in practice.





This role bridges two modes (split may vary over time):


Customer project work: deliver concrete analyses, data products, and insight pipelines for partner hospitals and projects.


Internal platform work: build the reusable foundations (datalake/lakehouse, ontology/terminology layer, evaluation/monitoring) that make those projects fast, reproducible, and production-grade.





What you will do





Lead applied research / analytics projects with pharma and clinical partners: independently scope questions, define datasets and success criteria, and deliver end-to-end outputs with medical stakeholders.


Build and operate scalable pipelines that transform raw clinical/patient data into structured, queryable, analysis-ready datasets.


Design and evolve a datalake / lakehouse approach on Azure (storage, compute patterns, governance, access controls).


Develop and maintain ontologies / terminology mappings and a consistent internal data model to enable reliable downstream analytics and agent reasoning.


Build “SynInsight”-style data products for partners (e.g., cohorts, endpoints, phenotypes, evidence-ready exports and reports) that are robust, reproducible, and measurable.


Implement LLM/agent operations: prompt/workflow versioning, evaluation harnesses, monitoring, regression testing, and cost/performance controls—using AI-assisted development tools (e.g., Claude Code, Codex) where helpful.


Build agents that automate R&D workflows (e.g., data-to-cohort pipelines, evidence synthesis, structured insight generation), andoperationalize them with proper evaluation and monitoring.


Drive privacy-preserving data capabilities, including synthetic data generation for development, evaluation, and safer sharing/testing in projects (including Azure-based implementations).


Ensure security, privacy, and compliance expectations are met when processing sensitive healthcare data in Germany/EU and the US (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2, BSI C5; US healthcare compliance alignment).



Qualifikation



Strong experience in applied data science / ML engineering / MLOps, ideally in pharma, R&D, or healthcare-adjacent environments.


Proven ability to build production-grade pipelines for messy real-world data (ETL/ELT, data quality, lineage, reproducibility).


Experience building and operating LLM/agent systems in production (workflows, evaluation, monitoring, reliability).


Strong coding skills (Python + SQL) and comfort with engineering best practices (tests, CI/CD, documentation).


Practical experience structuring data with ontologies/terminologies and making it usable for analytics and downstream systems.


Experience in AI-assisted programming (Claude Code, Codex, etc.)


Fluent in English (written and spoken).





Good to have





Experience with clinical terminologies and standards (e.g., ICD-10, SNOMED CT, LOINC, RxNorm/ATC).


Experience with modern data stack components (lakehouse patterns, columnar formats, distributed compute) on Azure.


Familiarity with privacy-preserving data processing (pseudonymization/de-identification, access partitioning, audit trails).


Experience delivering customer-facing data/ML projects end-to-end.


Experience with modern DataOps tooling for reproducible data and agent workflows (e.g. dbt, Dagster, or similar asset-based orchestration and transformation frameworks).





Real-world impact in oncology: build integrations that bring AI into clinical workflows where accuracy and trust matter.

High ownership: you will shape our interoperability layer end-to-end and define how we integrate at scale.

Show more

  • Build agents that automate R&D workflows (e.g., data-to-cohort pipelines, evidence synthesis, structured insight generation), andoperationalize them with proper evaluation and monitoring.

  • Drive privacy-preserving data capabilities, including synthetic data generation for development, evaluation, and safer sharing/testing in projects (including Azure-based implementations).

  • Ensure security, privacy, and compliance expectations are met when processing sensitive healthcare data in Germany/EU and the US (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC 2, BSI C5; US healthcare compliance alignment).


Qualifikation

  • Strong experience in applied data science / ML engineering / MLOps, ideally in pharma, R&D, or healthcare-adjacent environments.

  • Proven ability to build production-grade pipelines for messy real-world data (ETL/ELT, data quality, lineage, reproducibility).

  • Experience building and operating LLM/agent systems in production (workflows, evaluation, monitoring, reliability).

  • Strong coding skills (Python + SQL) and comfort with engineering best practices (tests, CI/CD, documentation).

  • Practical experience structuring data with ontologies/terminologies and making it usable for analytics and downstream systems.

  • Experience in AI-assisted programming (Claude Code, Codex, etc.)

  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).


Good to have



  • Experience with clinical terminologies and standards (e.g., ICD-10, SNOMED CT, LOINC, RxNorm/ATC).

  • Experience with modern data stack components (lakehouse patterns, columnar formats, distributed compute) on Azure.

  • Familiarity with privacy-preserving data processing (pseudonymization/de-identification, access partitioning, audit trails).

  • Experience delivering customer-facing data/ML projects end-to-end.

  • Experience with modern DataOps tooling for reproducible data and agent workflows (e.g. dbt, Dagster, or similar asset-based orchestration and transformation frameworks).


Real-world impact in oncology: build integrations that bring AI into clinical workflows where accuracy and trust matter.

High ownership: you will shape our interoperability layer end-to-end and define how we integrate at scale.

Title: Junior Data & AI Consultant (all genders)
Description:
Wir suchen ab sofort eine:n Junior Daten- & KI-Strategieberater:in (bei uns Intelligence Architect genannt), unbefristet, in Vollzeit oder mit mind. 32 Std. Du verbindest Strategieberatung und Projektmanagement mit Data & AI Fokus für einen namhaften Kunden im Bereich Mobilität. Arbeitsort ist Berlin mit der Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten.

Was wir tun

Wir befähigen Unternehmen unterschiedlicher Größe dazu, ihre Daten intelligent zu nutzen und letztlich aus eigener Kraft “AI-ready” zu werden. Dafür beraten und unterstützen wir unsere Kunden ganzheitlich, von der strategischen Ausrichtung über die Use-Case-Entwicklung und Technologie-Auswahl bis hin zur Entwicklung und dem Go-live der KI-Lösung. Das machen wir in persönlichen Gesprächen, Meetings, Workshops, (IT-)Großprojekten, Kursen und Community-Events und nutzen Stimme, Visualisierung, Code, Installationen und alles, womit wir arbeiten können. Außerdem nehmen wir uns immer einen Teil unserer Zeit für sol-Projekte – www.birdsonmars.com/sol – um zu inspirieren, zu diskutieren, zu kreieren und “das Neue” zu denken.

Wen wir suchen

Du hast dein Studium (z. B. Wirtschaftsinformatik, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen, BWL mit Tech-Fokus) gerade beendet und durch Praktika oder idealerweise durch eine erste Festanstellung im IT-Beratungsumfeld erste hands-on Erfahrungen gesammelt.
Die bist geübt im Umgang mit Tools wie Excel, Powerpoint, Miro oder Confluence.
Du bist neugierig und hast eine ausgeprägte Hands-on-Mentalität: Du liebst es, dich in neue Themen einzuarbeiten und Lösungen zu finden.
Du bist kontaktfreudig und fühlst dich auch im Umfeld großer Organisationen wohl.
Du gehst proaktiv auf Menschen zu und kommunizierst sicher auf Deutsch (min. C1).
Du begeisterst dich für die Mobilität der Zukunft und hast Lust, aktiv an der digitalen Transformation der Schieneninfrastruktur mitzuwirken.
KI ist für dich kein Fremdwort; idealerweise nutzt du KI-Tools intensiv in deinem Alltag oder sogar schon während deiner ersten Berufsstationen.

Deine Aufgaben

Du unterstützt unser Strategieteam in einem der größten Digitalprojekte Deutschlands.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Senior Intelligence Architects und Teilprojektleiter:innen auf Kundenseite zusammen und wirkst "Ende-zu-Ende" – von der ersten Datenstrategie bis zur Umsetzung von KI-Use-Cases - mit.
Du bereitest Workshops, Statusmeetings und Entscheidungsvorlagen vor und stellst sicher, dass im Team alle Fäden zusammenlaufen.
Du entwickelst dich schrittweise dahin, innerhalb eines Jahres erste Verantwortung für kleinere Teilprojekte selbständig zu übernehmen.
Du bist aktiver Teil unserer Kultur und bringst frische Impulse in unsere internen Formate und Diskussionen ein.




Was dir bei der Arbeit helfen wird

Data & AI Literacy (solides Grundwissen im Bereich Daten, KI und der wichtigsten Digitaltechnologien).
Ein grundlegendes Verständnis für Unternehmensstrategien und eine klare Vorstellung davon, wie KI als Hebel für echte Wertschöpfung in Organisationen wirkt.
Ein grundlegendes Verständnis von Produktmanagement und die Fähigkeit, Anforderungen entlang von User Value, ROI und technischer Machbarkeit einzuordnen.
Eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe und eine Hands-on-Mentalität.
Ein hohes Maß an Eigenorganisation und Zuverlässigkeit.
Die Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte pragmatisch aufzubereiten (z. B. in PowerPoint oder interaktiven Boards).
Eine gesunde Neugier und die Offenheit, in einem dynamischen Umfeld jeden Tag etwas Neues zu lernen.
Spaß an interdisziplinärer Teamarbeit zwischen Business, Daten und IT/AI-Engineering.

Was wir dir bieten

Ein tolles, vielseitiges und buntes Team - denn KI ist nur so vielfältig, kreativ und inklusiv wie die Menschen dahinter;
Eine offene und wertschätzende Kultur mit vielen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten im Team und Unternehmen;
Individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten;
Hybrides Arbeiten im Home Office / Remote UND im wunderschönen Vogelnest (unser Office) im Zentrum Berlins:
Vertrauensarbeitszeiten und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, für echte Vereinbarkeit von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf:
Team-Events, Sabbaticals, Gesundheitsvorsorge durch ergonomische Arbeitsplätze, Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft und Bikeleasing, Bibliotheksmitgliedschaft, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, sehr gutes Tech-Equipment und vieles mehr…

Vielfalt finden wir super. Daher begrüßen wir alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und geschlechtlicher Identität.

Du bist dir unsicher, ob du zur Stelle und die Stelle zu dir passt? Sprich gern unsere Kollegin Carina direkt an.

Come fly with us!

Title: People Lead
Description:
People Lead (German-speaking)

Location: Remote-first, Berlin-based

Package: €80,000 - €100,000 + equity




About the Opportunity:




We’re partnering with a Series A, VC-backed start-up operating at the intersection of AI and secure data collaboration.




Having successfully moved from early product development the business is now entering its first true scale phase. With an engineering-heavy team, growing customer demand and AI-enabled products already live, the focus is shifting towards building the people structures, leadership capability and culture required to scale sustainably.




At 40 employees today, the company is seeking a German-speaking People Lead to professionalise and own the people function as it grows towards 70+ and beyond.




This is a pivotal hire at a defining moment in the company’s journey.




The Role:




A direct report to the COO, you’ll partner closely with the CEO, CTO and broader leadership team to own the people agenda across the business.




This is not a role focused on building a large HR team or introducing heavy process. Instead, you’ll design and run pragmatic, high-quality people practices that enable engineers and leaders to perform at their best as the organisation grows.




You’ll act as a trusted partner to senior technical leaders, ensuring teams are structured effectively, supported through growth, and equipped with the behaviours, feedback and leadership capability needed to scale sustainably.




What You’ll Be Doing:




Own and continuously improve people processes across the full employee lifecycle, from hiring and onboarding through to performance management, development and retention.
Design clear, pragmatic performance frameworks that balance accountability, feedback and growth without unnecessary bureaucracy.
Drive professional development with a strong emphasis on soft skills, behavioural capability and leadership readiness, particularly within engineering teams.
Act as the primary people partner to the CTO, engineering managers and product leadership, supporting team effectiveness, communication and conflict resolution.
Take hands-on ownership of people operations, including employment matters, policies, compliance and coordination with external advisors, particularly in a German employment context.
Lead early-stage recruiting execution, including workforce planning, recruiter management and hands-on hiring where required.
Partner with the COO and CEO on organisational decisions, translating direction into structured actions and ensuring consistent follow-through.
Shape and strengthen culture in a remote-first environment, fostering trust, connection and sustainable ways of working as the business scales.




Your Profile:




6+ years’ experience in people, HR or organisational roles within highly engineering-led, technically or scientifically rigorous environments.
Demonstrated experience supporting growth in Series A or early Series B startups or scale-ups, typically from 0 to 100+ employees.
Fluent German and English, with the ability to operate confidently across senior stakeholder conversations and employment matters.
Strong track record of partnering with senior technical leaders and operating credibly at C-level.
Deep understanding of performance management, team dynamics and professional development within engineering organisations.
Comfortable operating hands-on in a remote-first business, with sound judgment on sensitive people matters.
Pragmatic, low-ego operator who enjoys building structure without over-engineering it.




Why Join?




True Series A impact. Shape the people foundations of a company moving from early success into meaningful scale.
Engineering-led, AI-first environment. Partner with highly technical teams building advanced AI-enabled products.
High trust, low bureaucracy. A culture that values clarity, autonomy and thoughtful execution over process.
Berlin hub, remote-first. Based in Berlin with flexibility and regular in-person connection.
Meaningful ownership. Competitive compensation, equity and the chance to leave a lasting imprint on how the business grows.




We recognise how competitive the current market is for senior People professionals, and Hawkwood is committed to providing a confidential, fair and positive candidate experience throughout.




If you’re interested in exploring this opportunity, please apply via this LinkedIn advert rather than by email or direct message. This ensures every application is reviewed fairly and consistently.

Title: Specialists in Data Analysis
Description:
Specialists in Data Analysis (Cat. I, Cat. II, Cat. III)




NTU International is preparing a proposal for the project “Cooperation Facility for the Philippines – Procurement of Technical Assistance to the Delegation of the European Union to the Philippines.”




In this context, NTU International is establishing a pool of qualified Non-Key Experts (Senior and Junior) to be mobilised on a short-term, on-demand basis during project implementation (48 months, expected start June 2026). Mobilisation will be subject to specific Terms of Reference and approval by the EU Delegation to the Philippines.




Requirements:

Education: Degree in statistics, economics, data science, or related fields
General professional experience: Experience in analytical or research roles
Specific professional experience: Data analysis, visualisation, evidence-based policy support
Language: English is mandatory




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or send to recruitment@ntu.eu. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted due to the large amount of applicants

Title: Analyst (Esports) (m/f/x)
Description:
Analyst (Esports)


Can you spot patterns, anomalies, and inefficiencies in the market with precision?
Do you enjoy analysing failures or incidents to improve trading decisions and strengthen automation going forward?
Do you like seeing your insights translated into better tools, models, or workflows?


If the answers to the above questions are yes, then this role could be ideal for you!

Support modelling and trading teams by analysing esports match data and market behaviour to improve odds accuracy and operational decisions, as well as performance monitoring for GRID's esports betting products across multiple titles.

What you will do


Conduct statistical analysis of esports match data and betting market behavior
Support validation and monitoring of odds models and pricing outputs
Identify patterns, anomalies, and inefficiencies in markets
Perform P&L analysis and variance investigations for trading operations
Prepare datasets and insights for traders and product teams
Analyze competitor offerings and market positioning
Assist with ad-hoc analytical requests from traders and management


Your skills will include


2+ years of experience in sports betting, trading, or quantitative analysis
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, or related field
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data manipulation
Strong understanding of probability theory and betting markets
Experience with SQL and at least one programming language (Python/R preferred)
Ability to work with large datasets and derive actionable insights


Nice to have


Interest in competitive gaming and esports ecosystems
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools


Benefits of working at GRID


Flexible working conditions
Mental health support
Company and team-wide events
Work travel opportunities with travel insurance
Training and development budget


About our culture


Flexibility: Work from the place that inspires and motivates you the most! From our awesome Berlin/ Wroclaw offices to the comfort of your own home. Meet up in person with your colleagues every so often, making use of the travel opportunities GRID offers
Sustainability: We want our employees to be well-rested and able to perform effectively. We offer a generous vacation allowance (28+ days a year) and the opportunity to speak with professional counselors to support mental health, covered by the business
Pragmatic: GRID thrives on being rational, allowing us to make the best decisions rather than keeping to rigid processes and procedures that don’t work well for us
Fostering growth: Empowering employees who are determined to grow by providing a self-development budget and strong career advancement opportunities. Support from your teammates to guide and encourage you to grow in your desired professional field
Company culture: We believe a diverse industry is best served with an inclusive and diverse workforce. With people based in over 24 countries, our latest employee survey shows that more than 98% agree GRID provides a supportive, effective remote work environment


About GRID

Founded in 2018 in Berlin, GRID offers the GRID Data Platform to the esports & games industry. Specializing in in-game and play-by-play data, GRID curates data for game developers and tournament organizers and leverages its data platform to unlock the potential of the right holders’ data assets for the purposes of storytelling, fan engagement, and integrity.

GRID’s official data partnerships cover multiple partnered rights holders (data sources) and integrated commercial data consumers, covering 15+ game titles. Our exclusive data partners include the likes of Riot Games, Ubisoft, Krafton, Moonton, BLAST, PerfectWorld, Hero Esports and CCT.

If you have the ambition and desire to work at the forefront of cutting-edge industry projects, then GRID is the place for you.

Apply today to find out more and begin your journey!

Title: Senior Data Analyst/ Analytics Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Aufgaben - Ownership & Ziele:

Als Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d) bist du der Motor hinter Rosentals datengetriebenem Wachstum. Du schaffst Transparenz über alle Business-Bereiche hinweg, übersetzt Zahlen in klare Entscheidungen und baust das Data & Insights Nervensystem auf, das unser weiteres Wachstum ermöglicht.


Du baust eine integrierte Datenbasis über alle Systeme hinweg (Shopify, Amazon, ERP, Marketing, Finance) und sicherst hohe Datenqualität, dabei minimierst du Error Rates und etablierst Datenvalidierungsprozesse.
Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards & Visualisierungen (Power BI, Looker oder Tableau) für alle Business-Bereiche.
Du etablierst ein einheitliches KPI-Framework (u. a. Revenue, CAC, DB, Stock- & Performance-KPIs) über alle Geschäftsbereiche hinweg.
Du lieferst Business Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Brand-, D2C- und Retail-Leads, denn deine Analysen und Empfehlungen beeinflussen direkt Marketing-, Brand- und Supply-Entscheidungen.
Du baust automatisierte Reporting- & Insight-Prozesse inklusive klarer KPI-Standards auf und implementierst wiederkehrende Reporting-Zyklen.
Du unterstützt Forecasting & Performance-Steuerung mit konsistenten, aktuellen und entscheidungsrelevanten Daten.


Profil - Erfahrungen & Fähigkeiten:


Du bringst 3–5 Jahre Erfahrung in Data Analytics, BI oder Analytics Engineering mit, idealerweise im E-Commerce-, Start-up- oder FMCG-Umfeld.
Du arbeitest sicher mit BI-Tools (Power BI, Looker, Tableau) und hast ein starkes Verständnis für KPIs & Business-Zusammenhänge.
Du beherrschst SQL und arbeitest routiniert mit Datenbanken, Excel/ Google Sheets sowie ERP-, Shopify- oder Amazon-Daten und kannst Rohdaten so aggregieren, dass alle Daten angezeigt und verarbeitet werden können.
Du hast nachweislich Reporting- und KPI-Strukturen aufgebaut oder skaliert.
Du kommunizierst Insights klar und adressatengerecht – vom Fachteam bis zum Founder-Level, außerdem bringst due Struktur in komplexe Zusammenhänge.
Du übernimmst Ownership für Datenqualität, Prozesse und Ergebnisse und bringst ein starkes Growth Mindset mit.


Warum wir

Arbeitsweise & Entwicklung:


Innovator & Disruptor: Wir bauen die Brand, an der sich andere Beauty-Marken orientieren.
Road to 100 Mio: Du bist in der Schlüsselrolle, unsere ambitionierten Ziele zu erreichen.
Data-Driven Decisions: Wir treffen faktenbasierte Entscheidungen und machen Erfolge mit OKRs kontinuierlich sichtbar.
High-Performance Culture: Wir sind ein Umfeld für Menschen, die skalieren, Verantwortung übernehmen und Karriere machen wollen.
Power-Team: 60+ A-Player, die Speed, Klarheit und Energie leben – ein inspirierendes Umfeld, das dich pusht.
Hybrides Arbeiten: Flexibilität trifft auf Kultur: Wir arbeiten hybrid, mindestens 2x pro Woche im Office für Austausch, Speed und Teamspirit.
Weiterentwicklung: Lernbudget, Mentoring und ein Umfeld, das dich nach vorn bringt.


Work-Life-Balance & Benefits:


Urlaub: 28 Urlaubstage + bis zu 2 Extra-Tage möglich.
Feiertage: Baden-Württembergische Feiertage + Weltfrauentag.
Mentale Gesundheit: Zugang zu nilo.health für mentale Fitness und Prävention.
Mobilität: Jobrad und monatlicher Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket.
Vorteile: Profitiere von einem exklusiven Rosental-Rabatt und einem Urban Sports Club Discount.
Etwas Gutes tun: Ein bezahlter Volunteering-Tag alle sechs Monate.


Über uns

Bevor du das Formular ausfüllst, möchten wir dich bitten, den DISC Persönlichkeitstest zu machen:

Er hilft uns, die Zusammenarbeit im Team besser zu verstehen – insbesondere in Bezug auf Kommunikation, Entscheidungsverhalten und mögliche Spannungsfelder. So können wir Teamdynamik und Arbeitsprozesse noch bewusster gestalten.

Du findest den kostenlosen Test hier: DISC-Persönlichkeitstest.de

Bitte lade einen Screenshot deines Ergebnisses im Formular unter DOKUMENTE *Andere* hoch.

Keine Sorge: Der Test erhebt keine sensiblen Daten und ist ein ergänzender Teil unseres Auswahlprozesses.

Nun zu uns:

Wir sind Rosental – ein Kick-Ass-Team, in dem jeder Einzelne zählt und echten Impact hat. Unser Ziel ist es, dein Leben ganzheitlich zu transformieren – nicht mit oberflächlichen Änderungen, sondern mit tiefgreifenden und nachhaltigen Veränderungen.

Mit unseren innovativen Produkten und Tools liefern wir dir mehr als nur Hautpflege – wir geben dir die Werkzeuge, um deine täglichen Rituale zu bereichern und dein Wohlbefinden zu steigern. Unsere Produkte kombinieren die besten natürlichen Inhaltsstoffe mit moderner Wissenschaft, um langfristige Veränderungen zu erzielen.

Diese Transformation geht weit über Hautpflege hinaus – sie betrifft alle Aspekte deines Wohlbefindens und hilft dir, ein erfüllteres, glücklicheres und gesünderes Leben zu führen. Wir existieren, um dich mit Lösungen zu unterstützen, die wirklich wirken und nachhaltige Veränderungen schaffen.

Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen und gemeinsam mit dir Großes zu erreichen!

Bitte beachte, dass wir Bewerbungen ausschließlich über unser Online-Formular entgegennehmen können. Bewerbungen per E-Mail oder Post können leider nicht bearbeitet werden.

Zum Zwecke der besseren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir ausschließlich das generische Maskulinum. Es steht geschlechtsneutral für alle Geschlechter. Jedes Geschlecht und jede Geschlechtsidentität ist bei uns willkommen.

Title: Head of Data (BI & Analytics)
Description:
Location: Full Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About The Company

The AI-driven trade platform transforming industrial supply in infrastructure, energy, and construction materials. It connects vetted suppliers across Asia, Europe, and the GCC region with local demand through a single integrated platform.

Its proprietary AI stack digitizes and automates the full lifecycle of materials trade — from procurement and pricing to inventory, logistics, and embedded financing — replacing thousands of manual, relationship-driven processes with real-time orchestration.

Buyers gain instant quotes, reliable availability, and predictable delivery through a unified operating system. Suppliers benefit from accurate forecasting, disciplined demand management, and seamless integration into cross-border fulfillment networks. The company partners with leading brands to run both dropship and cross-dock fulfillment motions for large-scale transactions, turning global supply chains into predictable, repeatable, software-like workflows.

Backed by top-tier investors and institutional financing partners, the company has scaled to triple-digit-million GMV, operates across six international markets, and is rapidly expanding toward profitability. With a team of 80+ people across Berlin (HQ) and Asia, it is building the world’s first industrial-grade AI operating system for materials — redefining how global trade works in one of the world’s largest and most essential industries.

About The Role

You will lead and further develop the Data functions, specifically the engine that turns raw operational signals into real-time intelligence for Sales, Operations, Procurement, and Finance.

This is not a back-office analytics role, it’s a front-line leadership role. You’ll own our data models, pipelines, and metrics - and develop AI-assisted systems that anticipate what happens next: which deal closes, which lane fails, which customer churns, which supplier delays, and how all our Agentic AI performs.

You’ll partner closely with Growth, Operations, and Product to turn data into a competitive advantage - running the daily rhythm of dashboards, forecasts, and decisions that move millions in GMV each week.

As part of our management leadership team, you will have a pathway to multi-region oversight, a highly competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives, and the opportunity to shape a high-performance organization from our Berlin headquarters, backed by top-tier investors.

Focus Areas


Build the data backbone: Own our warehouse, models, and BI stack (SQL etc.) and ensure single-source-of-truth visibility for every team.
Operationalise insights: Work directly with Sales and Ops leadership to translate signal into action, quota pacing, margin tracking, reactivation triggers, fulfillment risks.
Develop AI-assisted workflows: Collaborate with Tech to deploy GPT-based or agentic assistants for forecasting, pricing, and anomaly detection.
Elevate reporting: Move the company from descriptive to predictive, automate recurring reports, and power daily management decisions.
Own metrics: Define, implement, and track core KPIs across GMV, NRM, automation percentage and order quality.
Coach a small team of analysts: Hire, mentor, and scale an output-driven data team that combines speed with accuracy
Bridge teams: Integrate Data into the heartbeat of the business, Sales, Ops, Finance, Procurement, and Product all run off your dashboards.
Guarantee data quality: Clean pipelines, consistent definitions, zero ambiguity.


What Success Looks Like


100% alignment on KPI definitions across departments
Automated, self-updating dashboards for every business function.
Forecast accuracy >95%, margin reporting live by GMV, margin, and region.
One live AI-assisted data copilot embedded in Sales and Ops workflows within 3 months.
Significant reduction in manual reporting - ≥50% of recurring tasks automated.
Data stack clean, documented, and production-grade.
Weekly exec dashboards replacing static slide reports.


We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity drives innovation, creativity, and collective strength.

Title: Disponent (m/w/d) in Seefeld
Description:
Du hast ein Händchen für Planung und Koordination? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und sorge dafür, dass unsere Waren zur richtigen Zeit am richtigen Ort ankommen!

Was wir Dir bieten:


Tankkarte im Wert von 90 € pro Monat – für Deine Mobilität!
30 Tage Urlaub – Zeit, um neue Energie zu tanken!
Corporate Benefits – exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte, nur für Dich!
Deutschlandweit fit – mit dem Firmenfitnessprogramm EGYM Wellpass.
Business-Bike-Leasing – bleib in Bewegung!


Dein Aufgabenbereich:


Warendisposition & Lieferfähigkeit – Du sorgst dafür, dass alles zur richtigen Zeit am richtigen Ort ist
Auftragsbearbeitung – Von A bis Z in Deiner Hand
Fuhrpark & Speditionseinsätze – Planung ist Dein Ding, du hältst den Überblick
Kommunikation – Kunden, Fahrer, Speditionen – Du bist die zentrale Schnittstelle
Warenfluss organisieren – Du sorgst für reibungslose Abläufe


Das bringst Du mit:


Kaufmännischer Background – Ausbildung abgeschlossen, Zahlen und Abläufe im Griff
Erste Erfahrung? Nice-to-have! – Disposition, Spedition oder Ähnliches von Vorteil
Organisationstalent – Du hältst die Fäden in der Hand, auch wenn’s mal turbulent wird
Flexibel & belastbar – Herausforderungen? Nimmst Du mit links!
Strukturiert & eigenständig – Du siehst, was zu tun ist, und packst es an


Bist du bereit, Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte zu werden? Dann starte bei uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Disponent (m/w/d) in Seefeld in Vollzeit.

Hoyer – mehr als man denkt. Seit 1924 stehen wir für Qualität und Verlässlichkeit in der Energiebranche. Mit über 2.800 Kollegen gehören wir zu den Größten im Mittelstand. Werde Teil unserer Familie und bringe Deine Karriere ins Rollen!

Kontakt:

Wilhelm Hoyer B.V. & Co. KG

Recruiting

Rudolf-Diesel-Str. 1

27374 Visselhövede

Ansprechpartner: Markus Witte

Tel.: +49 4262 79 9664

www.hoyer.de

Title: Office Assistent.in (50%)
Description:
Herzog & de Meuron ist ein internationales Architekturbüro mit Sitz in Basel, Schweiz. Das Büro wurde 1978 gegründet und wird von den beiden Gründern, zusammen mit den Partnern und dem CEO geleitet. Heute engagiert sich ein internationales Team von über 500 Mitarbeitern an einer Vielzahl von Projekten in Europa, Amerika und Asien. Der Hauptsitz in Basel arbeitet mit Studios in Berlin und München, Barcelona, Paris, London, Hongkong, New York und San Francisco zusammen.







Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine.n Office Assistent.in (50%). Die Stelle ist auf 1 Jahr befristet mit der Option auf Verlängerung.







Ihre Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

Die Übernahme aller Assistenz-, Verwaltungs- und Sekretariatsaufgaben im Zusammenhang mit dem täglichen Büro- und Projektbetrieb, wie zum Beispiel:

Empfang, Bearbeitung und Ablage eingehender und ausgehender Dokumente in physischer und digitaler Form
Rechnungsstellung und vorbereitende Buchhaltung
Planung und Koordinierung von Besprechungen und Reiseplänen, Büromaterial, Organisation von Wartung der IT- Ausrüstung und in diesem Zusammenhangregelmässige Verbindung mit unserem Hauptsitz in Basel







Ihr Profil

Erfahrung in einer Sekretariats-, Büroassistenz- oder Projektadministrations-Position vorgesehen, vorzugsweise in einem Architektur-, Design- oder Baustellenbüro
Ein akademischer Werdegang oder eine Ausbildung in Büroorganisation
Grundkenntnisse in den Bereichen Kommunikation und IT sind von Vorteil
Sie verfügen über eine proaktive und flexible Arbeitseinstellung, eine hohe Kommunikationsfähigkeit, sind ein Organisationstalent und guter Teamplayer und können selbständig arbeiten
Gute Microsoft-Office-Kenntnisse inkl. PowerPoint sind erforderlich, ausserdem sprechen Sie fliessend Deutsch und Englisch (in Wort und Schrift), da diese Stelle sehr international ist







Gerne erwarten wir Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen in elektronischer Form (inkl. Motivationsschreiben, CV, Diplome und Zeugnisse) unter Erwähnung der Referenz B26-5. Bitte benutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.







Herzog & de Meuron

Human Resources / [B26-5]

Rheinschanze 6

CH-4056

Basel

Show more

Title: Head of Analytics
Description:
About Us

What if your work could drive change in a globally established industry, shaping processes that touch every corner of the world? At Forto, we are at the forefront of change, harnessing the power of AI to revolutionise logistics. We want to reinvent digital supply chains to be transparent, frictionless and sustainable. From day one, our mission has been to simplify global trade – creating a seamless and efficient logistics process.

About The Role

We are looking for a Head of Analytics who is a builder at heart to lead our Business Analytics and Product Analytics functions. Reporting to the Director of Strategic Finance, you will operate as a central data leader with influence spanning the entire organization—from Product and Engineering to Commercial and Operations.

In this role, you will be the bridge between raw data and strategic business decisions, acting as a true “player-coach.” In this role, you will balance strategic leadership with hands-on execution, actively contributing to the development of a scalable and integrated data landscape. You will drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities, moving from simply reporting on the past to providing forward looking insights which actively shape the future, ensuring that Forto’s data is not just accurate and actionable, but a world class competitive advantage.

Key Responsibilities


Lead & Develop the Team: You will manage and mentor the Analytics professionals. You are responsible for transforming this group into a world-class analytics unit, fostering a culture of curiosity, rigor, and rapid delivery.
Hands-On Execution: You will lead by example. We are a fast-paced scale-up, and in our high-growth environment, you will actively maintain a hands-on presence – architecting complex data models, developing critical dashboards, and executing high-priority analyses alongside your team.
Shape Data Strategy: You will move us beyond “service desk analytics” to “strategic partnership.” You will proactively identify growth levers, efficiency bottlenecks, and product opportunities using data.
Drive Data Quality and ensure Data Governance: You will be the primary feedback loop to our Data Engineering and product team. You won’t just consume data; you will actively collaborate with engineers to define requirements, fix quality issues upstream, and improve our data modeling standards.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: You will sit at the intersection of Business, Product, and Engineering. You will work closely with Product Managers to define success metrics and with various leaders to optimize business performance.


Required Skills And Experience


7+ years in Data Analytics or Data Science;
At least 4+ years of experience leading and managing teams in a high-growth, fast-paced environment (Scale-up or Tech startup preferred).
Advanced proficiency in SQL and modern analytics tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Tableau) and can review your team’s code and logic effectively. Python/R skills are a strong plus.
Augmented Intelligence: Drive the transition from descriptive to predictive analytics by architecting an AI-first data roadmap, leveraging LLMs and Machine Learning to automate insight generation and reduce ‘time-to-decision’.
Strategic Vision: You understand that data is a product. You have experience building analytics roadmaps that align with company OKRs and have a track record of using data to change business outcomes.
Engineering Fluency: You speak the language of Data Engineering. You understand data warehousing concepts (e.g., dbt, Snowflake, BigQuery) well enough to give technical feedback on data models and pipelines.
Business Acumen: You bring expertise in translating business requirements into data roadmap; leading with example in designing data architecture and also bring excellent project management skills.
At least 4+ years experience in hiring, developing, and retaining top talent. You know how to give radical candor with care and build a psychological safe environment for your team.


Don’t fit all of our criteria? That’s okay! We know that you might be hesitant to apply if you don’t meet all our requirements, but here at Forto, we pride ourselves on embracing diverse perspectives and celebrating potential. If you are passionate about this position and the Forto values, please apply anyway. There could be a place for you in this role – or another one that’s a perfect fit!

Why work with us?

Our team is hard-working, constantly seeking to maximise the impact of their work, but we put our people first, always winning with care. We value efficient systems and swift, direct communication. We want everyone to have their time to speak, so that we can embrace diverse perspectives to help drive towards solutions always.

About Us

At Forto, we are at the forefront of change, harnessing the power of AI to revolutionise logistics. We want to reinvent digital supply chains to be transparent, frictionless and sustainable. In this role, you will be the bridge between raw data and strategic business decisions, acting as a true “player-coach.” In this role, you will balance strategic leadership with hands-on execution, actively contributing to the development of a scalable and integrated data landscape. You will drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities, moving from simply reporting on the past to providing forward looking insights which actively shape the future, ensuring that Forto’s data is not just accurate and actionable, but a world class competitive advantage.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead & Develop the Team: You will manage and mentor the Analytics professionals. You are responsible for transforming this group into a world-class analytics unit, fostering a culture of curiosity, rigor, and rapid delivery.
  • Hands-On Execution: You will lead by example. We are a fast-paced scale-up, and in our high-growth environment, you will actively maintain a hands-on presence – architecting complex data models, developing critical dashboards, and executing high-priority analyses alongside your team.
  • Shape Data Strategy: You will move us beyond “service desk analytics” to “strategic partnership.” You will proactively identify growth levers, efficiency bottlenecks, and product opportunities using data.
  • Drive Data Quality and ensure Data Governance: You will be the primary feedback loop to our Data Engineering and product team. You won’t just consume data; you will actively collaborate with engineers to define requirements, fix quality issues upstream, and improve our data modeling standards.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: You will sit at the intersection of Business, Product, and Engineering. You will work closely with Product Managers to define success metrics and with various leaders to optimize business performance.

Required Skills And Experience

  • Advanced proficiency in SQL and modern analytics tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Tableau) and can review your team’s code and logic effectively. Python/R skills are a strong plus.
  • Augmented Intelligence: Drive the transition from descriptive to predictive analytics by architecting an AI-first data roadmap, leveraging LLMs and Machine Learning to automate insight generation and reduce ‘time-to-decision’.

Don’t fit all of our criteria? That’s okay! We know that you might be hesitant to apply if you don’t meet all our requirements, but here at Forto, we pride ourselves on embracing diverse perspectives and celebrating potential. If you are passionate about this position and the Forto values, please apply anyway. There could be a place for you in this role – or another one that’s a perfect fit!

Why work with us?

Our team is hard-working, constantly seeking to maximise the impact of their work, but we put our people first, always winning with care. We value efficient systems and swift, direct communication. We want everyone to have their time to speak, so that we can embrace diverse perspectives to help drive towards solutions always.

Title: Chief of Staff
Description:
About the Company

The company is the AI-driven trade platform transforming industrial supply in infrastructure, energy, and construction materials. It connects vetted suppliers across Asia, Europe, and the GCC region with local demand through a single integrated platform.

Its proprietary AI stack digitizes and automates the full lifecycle of materials trade — from procurement and pricing to inventory, logistics, and embedded financing — replacing thousands of manual, relationship-driven processes with real-time orchestration.

Buyers gain instant quotes, reliable availability, and predictable delivery through a unified operating system. Suppliers benefit from accurate forecasting, disciplined demand management, and seamless integration into cross-border fulfillment networks. The company partners with leading brands to run both dropship and cross-dock fulfillment motions for large-scale transactions, turning global supply chains into predictable, repeatable, software-like workflows.

Backed by top-tier investors and institutional financing partners, the company has scaled to triple-digit-million GMV, operates across six international markets, and is rapidly expanding toward profitability. With a team of 80+ people across Berlin (HQ) and Asia, it is building the world’s first industrial-grade AI operating system for materials — redefining how global trade works in one of the world’s largest and most essential industries.




Role Overview

As Chief of Staff, you are a strategic extension of the Founders and leadership team. You will drive high-impact company initiatives end-to-end, strengthen how we operate as we scale, and ensure that priorities translate into real outcomes. This role blends strategic leadership, organizational design, and hands-on execution. You will have broad exposure across the business and the mandate to shape how the company runs.




Key Responsibilities




Strategic Leadership & Initiative Execution

Lead critical strategic business initiatives from concept to successful delivery, partnering with senior leadership and department heads.
Enable effective executive decision-making by structuring problems, evaluating options, and guiding program design and rollout.
Serve as a trusted advisor to the Founders and leadership team—providing sharp insights, risk assessments, and actionable recommendations.
Translate business strategy into clear priorities, roadmaps, and measurable execution across teams.




Organizational Design & Operational Excellence

Review, design, and implement improvements to organizational structure; identify capability gaps and drive initiatives to close them.
Architect and optimize internal processes, workflows, formats, and meeting cadences to ensure scalable and efficient operations.
Drive cross-functional alignment by improving collaboration systems and introducing new ways of working.
Establish lightweight but rigorous operating rhythms that help teams move quickly while staying aligned.




Daily Operational Stewardship

Own core internal systems and tools that keep the company running (e.g., project billing, time tracking, budget sheets, invoicing).
Oversee daily operations with senior managers and department leads to ensure alignment, smooth execution, and reliable follow-through.
Ensure operational excellence by spotting friction early and fixing root causes, not just symptoms.
Support leadership with occasional high-leverage administrative coordination as needed to unblock priorities.




Executive Communication & Storytelling

Prepare strategic presentations, narratives, and materials for workshops, pitches, leadership meetings, and company-wide communication.
Develop clear, compelling content that drives alignment and supports executive and organizational decision-making.
Shape internal messaging by synthesizing complex topics into simple, decision-ready communication.
Act as a sparring partner to executives on story, structure, and strategic framing.




Cross-Functional Liaison & Culture Champion

Serve as a central connection point between staff, senior leaders, and the CEO—maintaining visibility into company climate, team health, project updates, and forward planning.
Build strong relationships across departments to increase responsiveness, resolve issues quickly, and unlock organizational efficiency.
Help reinforce a high-trust, high-performance culture by identifying misalignment early and supporting constructive solutions.




Project Management & Insight Generation

Track progress and performance across key initiatives, synthesizing findings into actionable insights for executives and stakeholders.
Surface opportunities, obstacles, and strategic options proactively to accelerate business outcomes.
Establish transparent reporting that enables leadership to steer effectively without creating bureaucracy.




Scope Boundaries / What This Role Is Not

To set you up for success, we want to be explicit about a few boundaries:

This is not a personal assistant role. You won’t be primarily responsible for calendars, travel bookings, or routine logistics.
You are not the catch-all owner for unpopular tasks. You will take on high-leverage problems, not low-value dumping ground work.
You are not expected to manage a large team. Influence and orchestration matter more than headcount ownership.
You may support with admin coordination occasionally, but only when it is the most efficient path to unlock strategic progress.




What Success Looks Like

Strategic initiatives move faster, with clearer ownership and better outcomes.
Leadership has high-quality insights, clean decision paths, and reliable execution.
The organization scales smoothly through improved structure, processes, and operating cadence.
Teams feel aligned, informed, and supported by strong cross-functional coordination.







We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity drives innovation, creativity, and collective strength.
